source: Calculating burst size
target: Calculating [Action] burst size [Measure-Type]

source: Take the FREE phage average of the time points on the plateau before the burst (A).
target: Take [Action] FREE [Modifier] phage average [Measure-Type] burst [Measure-Type]

source: Take the FREE phage average of the time points on the plateau after the burst (B).
target: Take [Action] FREE [Modifier] phage average [Measure-Type] burst [Measure-Type]

source: Subtract A from B; This is the total burst or new phages released (C).
target: Subtract [Action] burst [Measure-Type] new [Modifier] phages [Reagent] released [Modifier]

source: Divide C by the number of infecting phage (TOTAL phages at T0 minus FREE at T0); This is the burst size.
target: Divide [Action] number [Measure-Type] infecting phage [Reagent] phages [Reagent] FREE [Modifier] burst size [Measure-Type]

source: Therefore I use 58 °C as my annealing temperature

source: You can also check your optimal annealing temperature with various mathematical equations or the Thermo Fisher Tm calculator
target: check [Action] optimal [Modifier] annealing temperature [Measure-Type] Thermo Fisher Tm calculator [Device]

source: https://www.thermofisher.com/de/de/home/brands/thermo-scientific/molecular-biology/molecular-biology-learning-center/molecular-biology-resource-library/thermo-scientific-web-tools/tm-calculator.htm
In my case I use the following PCR protocol
target: use [Action] following [Modifier] PCR protocol [Method]

source: 1. Initial denaturation: 98° C - 2 min
target: Initial [Modifier] denaturation [Method] 98° C [Temperature] 2 min [Time]

source: 2. Denaturation: 98° C - 30 sec.
target: Denaturation [Method] 98° C [Temperature] 30 sec [Time]

source: 3. Annealing: Tm - 5° C - 30 sec -> I use 58° C here
target: Annealing [Method] Tm [Measure-Type] 5° C [Temperature] 30 sec [Time] use [Action] 58° C [Temperature]

source: 4. Extension: 72° C - 1 min.
target: Extension [Method] 72° C [Temperature] 1 min [Time]

source: 5. Final extension: 72° C - 10 min
target: Final [Modifier] extension [Method] 72° C [Temperature] 10 min [Time]

source: 6. 4° C holdRerun the second to forth step for 35 times
target: 4° C [Temperature] hold [Action] Rerun [Action] second to forth [Modifier] step [Method] 35 times [Numerical]

source: Note from Thermo Fisher:The recommended extension step is 1 min.
target: recommended [Modifier] extension [Method] 1 min [Time]

source: for PCR products up to 2kb.
target: PCR products [Reagent] up to [Modifier] 2kb [Generic-Measure]

source: For longer products, the extension time should be prolonged by 1 min/kb.
target: longer [Modifier] products [Reagent] extension time [Measure-Type] prolonged [Action] 1 min/kb [Generic-Measure]
